question.body: Which plexus would arise from cervical and thoracic spinal nerves and give rise to radial, ulnar and axillary peripheral nerves?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This would arise from cervical spinal nerves only and include lesser occipital nerve.
Correct. The term brachial also refers to upper limb, so these nerves serve the arm even though they arise from plexus formed by both lower cervical and upper thoracic spinal nerves.
Incorrect. This would arise from lumbar spinal nerves only and include femoral nerve.
Incorrect. This would arise from sacral spinal nerves only and include the tibial nerve.
Incorrect. This would arise from both lower sacral and coccygeal nerves.

part.hint: Think about your body region terms and bones, because many nerves are named for these related structures.
